message.entry:
Here are some things you might want to try next:
  • Click Validate in the Cluster Profile Manager to ensure the new cluster works.
  • Start a parallel pool on the cluster, then use parfor or spmd.
  • Submit a batch job to the cluster.
You have successfully added the cluster "{0}" to the Cluster Profile Manager list.
Creating a profile for the selected cluster.
The selected cluster already has profile(s) associated with it. Clicking on the Next button will create an additional profile.
The selected cluster is running a version of MATLAB incompatible with this client session.

• There might not be any clusters available to you.

    You can use the Create Cloud Cluster wizard to build your custom cloud cluster.

  • You might have access to a cluster that is not automatically discoverable.

    You can import the cluster definition. If you do not have such a file, then contact the cluster administrator. To learn more about clusters that may be available to you, contact your system administrator.
Set new cluster as default and restart the parallel pool
The following clusters were found. Some clusters are running a version of MATLAB that is incompatible with this client session.

entry.note: The type of the discovered cluster. This is the scheduler type (MJS, HPC Server).

message.entry:
Welcome to the Discover Clusters Wizard.


Use this wizard to find clusters running on MathWorks Cloud Center. Only clusters associated with your MathWorks Account ({0}) will be listed.


Click Next to start the discovery process.
Select this option to find clusters running on Cloud Center. You must provide your MathWorks Account login information to access these clusters.
Where do you want to look for MATLAB Parallel Server clusters?
Select this option if your clusters use a MATLAB Job Scheduler, Microsoft Windows HPC Server or other third-party scheduler.
